message.content:
Sure — what kind of secret key do you want to test (API key, JWT/HMAC secret, AES encryption key, SSH/GPG/TLS private key, cloud credentials, etc.)? I can give exact commands/snippets. For now, here’s a compact checklist and quick test commands for common types so you can pick what matches yours.

General safety first
- Don’t paste the real secret here or anywhere public. Share a masked example if you want help debugging.
- Prefer to test in a safe environment (local machine or isolated container).

API key
- Quick functional test: make an authenticated request using curl (replace HEADER/KEY/URL):
  curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_KEY" https://api.example.com/endpoint
- If it returns 200 or expected data the key works; 401/403 means invalid/insufficient perms.

JWT / HMAC secret
- Verify a JWT’s signature with a library. Python example (PyJWT):
  import jwt
  jwt.decode(token, "YOUR_SECRET", algorithms=["HS256"])
- If it raises InvalidSignatureError then the secret is wrong.

AES / symmetric encryption key
- Check length: base64 decode then count bytes:
  echo -n "BASE64_KEY" | base64 --decode | wc -c
  Valid AES lengths: 16, 24, 32 bytes (128/192/256 bits).
- Round‑trip test: encrypt known plaintext and decrypt it with the key (OpenSSL example with a hex key):
  printf "hello" > plain.txt
  openssl enc -aes-256-cbc -K <HEX_KEY> -iv <HEX_IV> -in plain.txt -out c.enc
  openssl enc -d -aes-256-cbc -K <HEX_KEY> -iv <HEX_IV> -in c.enc

SSH private key
- Check and extract public key:
  ssh-keygen -y -f /path/to/private_key
- Test connection:
  ssh -i /path/to/private_key user@host

GPG secret key
- List secret keys:
  gpg --list-secret-keys

TLS / RSA private key
- Check validity and consistency:
  openssl rsa -in key.pem -check
- Compare with certificate:
  openssl x509 -noout -modulus -in cert.pem | openssl md5
  openssl rsa -noout -modulus -in key.pem | openssl md5
  (hashes should match)

Cloud credentials
- AWS: try a simple call with AWS CLI:
  AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=... AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=... aws sts get-caller-identity
- GCP / Azure have similar CLI validation commands.

Format/encoding checks
- Is it base64 or hex? Quickly inspect and decode:
  echo -n "KEY" | base64 --decode >/dev/null && echo "base64" || echo "not base64"
  echo -n "KEY" | xxd -r -p >/dev/null && echo "hex" || echo "not hex"
- Check entropy/length: echo -n "KEY" | wc -c (bytes) or base64 decode first to count raw bytes.

If you tell me which type of key you have and where you want to use it, I’ll give an exact one-liner or short script to test it.
